ALERT ğŸš¨: The @BNBCHAIN X account is compromised.

The hacker posted a bunch of links to phishing websites that ask for Wallet Connect.

Do NOT connect your wallet.

Security teams have notified X already, working to suspend the account first, then restore access.

Also take-down requests to take down all phishing websites. 

Always check the domains very carefully, even from official X handles. 

Stay SAFU!

tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
Hello everybody,

A drain bridge hack just happened on one of our $SFUND bridges. We are investigating the issue. We had audits on all these contracts, and been running the same bridge contracts for over 3 years.

We already contacted Layerzero as well.

We will be updating you with the information, as we gather more info, and then do absolutely everything to work with authorities and cyber security groups to find the hackers.

Thank you!
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
[3/3] âš™ï¸ How This Attack Works:

Similar to our previous alert: localhost:8080/realScamSniffer/statusâ€¦

1ï¸âƒ£ Official invite expires
2ï¸âƒ£ Scammer claims the SAME vanity URL
3ï¸âƒ£ All legacy links become phishing traps
4ï¸âƒ£ Fake verification bots steal assets via phishing site

Remember: Always double-check what you're signing. Verify URLs through official channels.
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
[2/3] ğŸ”´ Multiple Projects Compromised

Verisense Network(@veri_sense) Discord invite also hijacked using the same attack pattern.

This is systematic - scammers are claiming expired vanity URLs across the ecosystem. They're weaponizing outdated links in:
â€¢ Project documentation
â€¢ Social media profiles
â€¢ Historical tweets

Projects: Check & Update your Discord links NOW.
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
[1/3] ğŸš¨ Discord Invite Link Hijacking Alert

The Kiloex Discord invite discord[.]gg/kiloex has EXPIRED and been taken by scammers.

âš ï¸ Active threat vectors:
â€¢ Coingecko & CoinMarketCap profiles STILL link to the compromised invite
â€¢ Historical Kiloex tweets contain the hijacked link

We've received victim reports TODAY of asset theft via phishing signatures.

tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ What is Transaction History Poisoning?

1. Scammer sends fake/dust transfer with a similar address
2. Their fake address appears in your transaction history
3. You copy the address from history thinking it's legitimate
4. Your funds get sent to the scammer instead

tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
These North Korean hackers are advanced, creative and patient. I have seen/heard:

1. They pose as job candidates to try to get jobs in your company. This gives them a â€œfoot in the doorâ€. They especially like dev, security, finance positions.

2. They pose as employers and try to interview/offer your employees. During the interview, they will be a problem with Zoom and they will send your employee a link to an â€œupdateâ€, which contains virus that will takeover your employeeâ€™s device. Or they will give your employee a coding question and later send some â€œsample codeâ€.

3. They pose as users and send you links in a Customer Support request. The linked page will have a virus to download of some kind.

4. They pay/bribe your employees, outsourced vendors for data access. Just a few months ago, a major India outsource service was hacked and leaked a major US exchange user data, resulting in user asset loss of more than $400m.

The list goes onâ€¦

To all crypto platforms, train your employees to not download files, and screen your candidates carefully.

Stay SAFU. ğŸ™
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ EIP-7702 autoâ€‘drain case
Leaked key â†’ delegated to a malicious 7702 contract. After bridging, the contract fallback auto-forwarded native token in the same txâ€”no attacker tx needed. Looks like a bridge issue, but the wallet was already compromised.

Takeaways:
- Phishers love 7702: batch signatures = oneâ€‘click drain (weâ€™ve seen multiâ€‘million losses).
- With a leaked key, attackers use 7702 autoâ€‘drainers to siphon any incoming native token instantly.

Advice:
- Key leaked? Removing the 7702 delegation is uselessâ€”theyâ€™ll reâ€‘delegate. Treat the wallet as burned; migrate now.
- Donâ€™t sign 7702 batches you donâ€™t fully understand.

Stay sharp and sign carefully.
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content: 2/2 More details: the malware targets CI (e.g., GitHub Actions) and reads env vars and tokens (GITHUB_TOKEN, NPM tokens, etc.) to exfiltrate credentials/secrets. If potentially impacted, audit recent installs/build logs, revoke/regenerate tokens, rotate secrets, and pin/verify package versions.
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ Another NPM supply chain attack

`@ctrl/tinycolor` (2.2M weekly downloads) shipped malicious versions that run an infostealer during npm postinstall to scan for and exfiltrate sensitive data. The payload abuses TruffleHog, a legitimate secret scanner.

Check if you pulled affected versions, pause installs/updates, and pin to known-good releases.

Source: socket.dev/blog/tinycolor-suâ€¦
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
Request Finance incident report: Frontend was compromised to inject malicious approvals.

Full report: help.request.finance/en/artiâ€¦
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
This case highlights critical security concerns:
âœ“ Malicious approvals can be hidden in batch transactions
âœ“ Attackers use verified contracts with near-identical addresses
âœ“ Attack vectors can include app vulnerabilities, malware, or compromised frontends
âœ“ Multi-send functionality can obscure malicious operations

Always verify:
â€¢ Every approval in batch transactions
â€¢ Contract addresses character by character

Stay vigilant - attacks can occur through multiple vectors during legitimate app usage.
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
Request Finance posted an alert:
"A malicious actor deployed a lookalike of Request Finance's Batch Payment contract. One customer was affected, the vulnerability has already been fixed."

Possible attack vectors could include:
â€¢ App vulnerability
â€¢ Malware/browser extension modifying transactions
â€¢ Compromised frontend/DNS hijacking
â€¢ Other injection methods

Exact mechanism remains unclear.
Please refer to official reports for detailed findings.

app.safe.global/apps/open?saâ€¦
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
The attack timeline reveals careful preparation:
â€¢ 13 days ago: Attacker deployed fake contract with Etherscan verification
â€¢ The malicious contract had multiple "batchPayments" transactions to appear legitimate
â€¢ Yesterday: Batch transaction via Request Finance app interface contained hidden malicious approval (TX: 0x2ed88b7a179b32a129b85cdf94fe50c4d8acee78e9af3da69c12aea3dd29ca47)
â€¢ Funds immediately swapped to ETH and deposited to Tornado Cash

app.safe.global/transactionsâ€¦
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ A victim lost $3.047M USDC yesterday through a sophisticated attack involving a fake Request Finance contract on Safe wallet.

Key findings:
â€¢ Victim's 2/4 Safe multi-sig wallet shows batch transaction via Request Finance app interface
â€¢ Hidden within: approval to malicious contract 0x3Cf6e5...c03F mimicking legitimate 0x3cF638...C03f
â€¢ Both addresses share identical first/last characters
â€¢ Malicious contract was verified on Etherscan

Sources: @zachxbt, @evilcos, Safe wallet transaction history
tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ NPM Supply Chain Attack ğŸš¨

Popular dev qix fell victim to phishing. Malicious code injected into npm packages now hijacks crypto transactions at signing.

Attack method:
â€¢ Hooks wallet functions (request/send)
â€¢ Swaps recipient addresses in ETH/SOL transactions
â€¢ Replaces addresses in network responses

Affected: chalk, strip-ansi, color-convert & more

Stay safe:
âœ“ Verify recipient/amount on wallet screen
âœ“ Check if addresses change after pasting
âœ“ Review recent transactions
âœ“ Use hardware wallets for high-value ops

Details: jdstaerk.substack.com/p/we-jâ€¦

tweets.author: realScamSniffer

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨SlowMist TI AlertğŸš¨

There are rumors of an exploit on @VenusProtocol. Our ongoing joint analysis indicates this may not be an issue with the protocol or frontend itself, but rather a targeted #phishing attack on a whale.ğŸ•µï¸

The attacker appears to have replaced a wallet extension, so a normal redeemUnderlying call was swapped with updateDelegate:
ğŸ”— bscscan.com/tx/0x75eee705a23â€¦

This led to the loss of Venus assets:
ğŸ”— bscscan.com/tx/0x4216f924ceeâ€¦

Prep work suggests the attack was well-planned. Gas was sourced via #XMR swaps, and other funds trace back to #eXch.

ğŸ”We are in touch with the whale. Many details are still under review; actual losses are being assessed.

Attacker addr: bscscan.com/address/0x7fd8f8â€¦

We share these updates to prevent unnecessary market panic. Please note: this information is preliminary and subject to change.

tweets.content:
ğŸš¨ What is Transaction History Poisoning?

1. Scammer sends fake/dust transfer with a similar address
2. Their fake address appears in your transaction history
3. You copy the address from history thinking it's legitimate
4. Your funds get sent to the scammer instead

ğŸš¨eXch had 34M euros and infrastructure for the platform seized by law enforcementğŸš¨

ğŸ“…On April 30, the Frankfurt am Main Public Prosecutor's Office - Central Office for Combating Internet Crime (ZIT) - and the Federal Criminal Police Office (BKA) seized the German server infrastructure of the crypto swapping service "eXch" and shut down the platform. The service was accessible under the domain eXch[.]cx and various other internet addresses. In addition to extensive data of over eight terabytes, the crypto assets #Bitcoin, #ETH, #Litecoin, and #Dash, currently valued at approximately ğŸ’¶â‚¬34 million, were seized. This is the third-largest seizure of crypto assets in the history of the BKA.

ğŸ“¡The operators of @exchcx are suspected of engaging in commercial money laundering and operating a criminal online trading platform. The operators had initially announced at short notice that they would discontinue their service on May 1, 2025..
